original: Bucht, Ruth Maria, läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 5/2/02 i Vasa, Finl., av vicekonsul Georg B. o. Gertrud Hartman. Stud:ex. i Sthlm 23, fil. mag. i Upps. 27, provår v. norra real i Sthlm 31-32. Timlär. i Djursholm 27-28, ämneslär. v. nya elem:sk. f. fl. i Sthlm 28-31, extralär. v. Gbgs fhck-lärov. 32-37, e. o. adj. där 38-43, adj. i tyska o. franska där sed. 43. Res. t. Tyskl. 10, 11, 26 o. 30, Frankr. 20-21, 29, 33, 37 o. 38, Engl. 21-22, 24, 28, 33, 37 o. 46, Ital. 34, Tyskl., Österr., Ung. o. Tjeckoslov. 35, USA 36, Ital. o. Grekl. 39, Finl., Norge o. Danm. uppr. ggr.
translated: Bucht, Ruth Maria, high school teacher, Gothenburg, born on February 5, 1902 in Vaasa, Finland, to Vice Consul Georg B. and Gertrud Hartman. She completed her studies with a Bachelor's degree in Stockholm in 1923 and a Master's degree in Uppsala in 1927. She did her trainee year at Norra Real in Stockholm from 1931-1932. From 1927-1928 she was a substitute teacher in Djursholm, from 1928-1931 she was a subject teacher at a new elementary school in Stockholm and in 1932-1937 an extra teacher at the Gothenburg high school. She was a temporary associate professor there from 1938-1943 and has been a permanent associate professor in German and French since 1943. She has travelled to Germany in 1910, 1911, 1926, and 1930, France in 1920-1921, 1929, 1933, 1937 and 1938, England in 1921-1922, 1924, 1928, 1933, 1937 and 1946, Italy in 1934, and to Germany, Austria, Hungary, and Czechoslovakia in 1935, the USA in 1936, Italy and Greece in 1939, and Finland, Norway, and Denmark several times. She married, but no year is given.
